Html:
I have two problems.

1.- When I throw a popup with excel file, the window closes.
code
var URL = \"http://www.dom.com/excel.xls\";
day = new Date();
id = day.getTime();
eval(\"page\" + id + \" = window.open(URL, '\" + id + \"', 'toolbar=1,scrollbars=0,location=0,statusbar=0,menubar=0,resizable=0,width=100,height=200,left = 0,top = 0');\");

2.- I have 2 reports designed to work with ajax and one of them stays "Loading" forever and file never appear.

Solutions:
1.- I can do the xls redirected and solve the problem.
2.- Is any flag to know if the excel file is ready ? (I've tried if($objWriter->save('file.xls')) with no results)

Thankx alot.

1. Seems like the best solution?
2. No, you can, for example, write a flag to a file on your server when starting (flag=0), at the end of the script (flag=1).

Might I ask how are you displaying an excel file? I'm curious how to show xls on a page.
Thanks,
James
